com.ibm.streamsx.topology.messaging.kafka

Class ProducerConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.streamsx.topology.messaging.kafka.ProducerConnector

  • public class ProducerConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple connector to an Apache Kafka cluster for producing Kafka messages -- publishing a TStream<Message> to Kafka topics.

    A single connector is for a specific Kafka Broker as specified in the producer configuration.

    A connector can create any number of producers in the topology. A producer can publish to one or more topics.

    Sample use: 

     Topology top = ...
 Properties producerConfig = ...
 ProducerConnector pc = new ProducerConnector(top, producerConfig);
  
 TStream myStream = ...
 TStream msgsToSend = myStream.transform(MyType to SimpleMessage);
 pc.publish(msgsToSend, "myTopic");
    See Also:
    http://kafka.apache.org, com.ibm.streamsx.messaging

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProducerConnector

        public ProducerConnector(TopologyElement te,
                         java.util.Properties config)
        Create a producer connector for publishing tuples.

        See the Apache Kafka documentation for KafkaProducer configuration properties at http://kafka.apache.org.

        Minimal configuration typically includes:

        • metadata.broker.list
        • serializer.class
        • request.required.acks
        Parameters:
        config - KafkaProducer configuration information.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfig

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getConfig()
        Get the connector's KafkaProducer configuration information.
        Returns:
        the unmodifiable configuration

      • publish

        public void publish(TStream<? extends Message> stream)
        Publish stream tuples to the Kafka Broker. Each stream tuple is sent to the topic specified by its Message.getTopic(). Same as produce(stream, null).
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to publish

      • publish

        public void publish(TStream<? extends Message> stream,
                    java.lang.String topic)
        Publish stream tuples to the Kafka Broker.

        If topic is null, each tuple is published to the topic specified by its Message.getTopic(). Otherwise, all tuples are published to topic.

        The messages added to Kafka include a topic, message and key. If Message.getKey() is null, an empty key value is published.

        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to publish
        topic - topic to publish to. May be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an empty topic is specified.
